newsitem.title: USA: Rain in all areas of Florida citrus belt - FASS.
newsitem.headline: Rain in all areas of Florida citrus belt - FASS.

text.p: There was rain in all areas of the Florida citrus belt this week, the Florida Agricultural Statistics Service (FASS), said.
Trees are now in very good condition as a result of all the recent rain.
New crop fruit is making normal progress for mid-April, according to FASS.
Caretakers are cutting cover crops that are competing with the trees for nutrients.
Hedging, topping, and removing debris are active in all areas, FASS said.
FASS said an estimated 6,251,000 boxes of Valencia oranges were harvested in the week ended April 20, up from 7,015,000 in the prior week and compared with 7,088,000 during the week ended April 6.
